snippet: Baadur Jobava of the republic of Georgia won the International Open Tournament, an event held in honor of one of the greatest players of the 20th century.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column examines Baadur Jovava's victory at International Open Tournament in Minsk, Belarus, held in honor of chess master David Bronstein.
lead_paragraph: Baadur Jobava of the republic of Georgia won the International Open Tournament, an event held in honor of one of the greatest players of the 20th century.

headline.print_headline: A Player’s Attacks Pay Off at a Tournament in Minsk
headline.main: A Player’s Attacks Pay Off at a Tournament in Minsk
